description: This garden behind the new Salvation Army headquarters originally reached from 47th to 48th street.  The rebuilt garden now faces 48th street.  Children from the Mid-Town West School garden in pie shaped cobblestone lined raised beds.  The front area is their �forest� of Ailanthus trees. A flagstone pathway rings the rear of the garden and leads to a tool shed. Ornamental shrubs and butterfly attracting plants hide the low wrought iron fence.  The science teachers make ample use of this outdoor classroom.
name: Marian S. Heiskell Garden
